revised_title: The In Vitro Development of Mammalian Ovaries and Ovogenesis
tldr: The author conducted experiments to cultivate entire ovaries of embryonic and newborn rats and mice in vitro to study their growth and differentiation, particularly focusing on ovogenesis. The results showed that the entire process of oogenesis can occur in vitro under appropriate conditions, providing new insights into the factors responsible for the growth and development of the ovary and the inherent capacity of germ cells for independent growth and differentiation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
